p.s: In the following the given scene will be analyzed with regards to the presentation of Chris and his relationship to Starr.
Chris is a funny and self confident person, who sometimes is rash but still can be serious and romantic.
His relationship to Starr is full of love but still not without conflicts.
Chris' self confidence and happiness is built on beeingbeing liked in school and his friends.
This is especailly pointed out by the first scene which is shown to the viewer in slow motion and in which Chris greets his friends.
His emotions in this scene are brought to the viewer by medium close ups of his head from different sides and angles.
His rashness can notcannot be seen in this sequence but by Starr's reaction to him and the Condom-Gate.
Her emotions are also brought through close ups which are especially in the argument between Starr and Chris, fastly alternating between them.

In this scene Chris's seriousness is proven by his emotions and the deeper, more serious voice, but he still is a person which isn't too serious proven by solving the argue by dancing to his beat in public, which is brought to the viewer in another slow motion, proving his self-confidence.
That their relationship is romantic and full of love can be seen in the first scene too.
As Chris walks through the hallway a romantic song is played in which a woman sings about the ocean eyes of another person.
The camera is from StarrsStarr's perspective.
This position is used to tell the viewer that the romantic music is showing StarrsStarr's real emotions for Chris.
The slow-motion is used to give the music more time to display its effect.
But, their relationship still has serious moments too.
Although Starr first smiles when she hears the new beat Chris made, she gets serious again because Chris did something she didn't like.

Her dissappointmentdisappointment is underlined by her acting, especially by her, looking down on the ground twice in the one close up, showing Chris how small he is for her in the moment and expressing that he is metaphorical on the ground for her.
But this argue is solved by Chris dancing, which shows Starr that he is even ready to do unpleasant things in public just to make her happy, which proves the strong relationship.
Making her laugh is also one of the two main positive things about him according to Starr.
The second are his Jordans, which she really likes.
That is brought to the viewer by her inner monologmonologue about his shoes and her looking at the shoes which can be seen by the camera focusing on them out of her position.
As proven, they have a strong and loving relationship.
The hypothesis about Chris is also proven by his appearance and theythe way it is brought to the viewer.
